description.en: The course will cover the role of money in economy and economic models, and the role of monetary policy in economic cycles and stabilization policy.
description.et: Kursuses käsitletakse raha rolli majanduses ja majandusmudelites, ning rahapoliitika olulisust majandustsüklite ja stabilisatsioonipoliitika kontekstis.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to discuss more deeply topics of macro economics related to the role of the money and monetary policy
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on käsitleda sügavamalt makroökonoomika teemasid, mis on seotud selgitada raha ja rahapoliitika rolliga majanduses

learning_outcomes.en: After passing the course the student
* understand the role of the money in the macro-economy and macro-economic models;
* understand the role of monetary policy in macroeconomic stabilization.

grade_preconditions.et: Evaluation criteria will be agreed with the students in the first lecture

grade_evaluation.et: The points will be converted to the grades as follows: 1) score 90-100: A; 2) 80-89: B:, 3) 70-79: C; 4) 60-69: D; 5) 50-59: E; 6) Less than 50% - F (failed).

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:

Additional readings will be distributed during the course.

description.et: Introduction to the monetary policy, empirical evidence on the role of money, money neutrality. Practical aspects of monetary policy.
Classical Monetary Model, neutrality and super-neutrality of money
Nominal rigidities and short-run effects of monetary policy
Stabilization policy, monetary policy rules vs discretion, monetary policy transmission mechanism
Operational aspects of monetary policy and lessons learned from the crises.

audience.et: The participants need to have taken at least intermediate level microeconomics and macroeconomics courses.
